Module com.example.c482pa
Package com.example.c482pa.controllers

Class AddProductController

java.lang.Object
com.example.c482pa.controllers.AddProductController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddProductController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class focuses on the add product screen. It includes methods for adding a product, canceling the addition of a new product, validating the product, and initializing the table views.

    • handlePartSearch

      void handlePartSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Searches for a specific part
      Parameters:
      event - Search field action

    • addPart

      void addPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Will add the selected part into the table view for parts associated with a product
      Parameters:
      event - Add button action

    • handleSaveProduct

      void handleSaveProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Once the user wants to save a product, this method will cover the following mentioned below. Get the TextField value entered in. Convert the value to a String and pass it into another method for validation. If no error message is displayed, then the product will be added with any related parts if included. The user will then be redirected back to main screen.
      Parameters:
      event - Save button action
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader

    • productValidation

      public static String productValidation(String productName, int inven, double price, int min, int max, String eMessage)
      This method will take in all Textfield values and validate them. If any of these variables contains incorrect data, then an error message is returned.
      Parameters:
      productName - The product name
      inven - The stock level
      price - The price of the product
      min - The min stock level
      max - The max stock level
      eMessage - The error message
      Returns:
      The error message

    • handleDeletePart

      void handleDeletePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method removes any selected parts relating to the product. A confirm box is displayed. If the user confirms the deletion, the selected part is removed. If not, then it will not be removed.
      Parameters:
      event - Remove Associated Part button

    • handleCancelProduct

      void handleCancelProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      If the user clicks the cancel button, a confirmation box is displayed. If the user confirms the cancellation, then they will be redirected to the main screen and the product will not be added. If the user does not confirm the cancellation, they will remain on the same screen.
      Parameters:
      event - Cancel button action
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      The table views and the product id field are initialized.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - Points to any specified resource such as a file or link
      resourceBundle - Locale-specific data from the end user's side
